comments.body: What would be the use of this block? Maybe not flammable stairs? Or wool stairs?
Great idea, especially for builders.
Think about wool slabs also and concrete slabs and stairs
Or putting a carpet on any stair block. That has the colour of the carpet and something to make stairs look a better with the rest of your build
what about carpets on slabs?
Yes.  Carpet placed on stairs.  Just like carpet on floor, but, bends to cover the stair block.
Great Idea! I came up with it and was about to post it, but it auto searched and I found this! Exactly what I was thinking!
Maybe so that there is a visible carpet going down (3D carpet)
Carpet stairs, and Minecraft, YOU LISTEN 2 THIS! I’m TRYING to make my houses PRETTY but stairs, ladders,or scaffolding just doesn’t look good. I WANT CARPETED STAIRS

I was just thinking about this because you can place a carpet on a stair block but it’s on top of the whole block, I think it should cover the block itself for design purposes, and it would just make sense. And also while on this discussion on top of slabs too.
as a stair would be wool stairs, but on top of stair is technically a carpet stair.
Ive been waiting since 2011 for Carpet stairs please add them Do not prolong my suffering.
This is already a suggestion.
I regret wasting 5 irons i should craft tools lol
Yeah, this would be very useful! I was making decoration for my nether portal and it took me so long to smelt the cobblestone to make stone bricks.
Maybe blast furnaces directly make cobble stone smooth stone
I agree, blast furnaces are currently useless. You generally don't sit around and wait for ore to smelt. Making glass, smooth stone and even food would make it useful.
401226828991 Blast furnaces will never be able to make food, the smoker is already there for you to cook on. But sand and other things would be SOO helpful!
IT DOES NOT SMELT
I totally support this idea, however I'd suggest changing the title. Blast Furnaces are useful. Just not as useful as they should be.
Ah from reddit!  I think it's a nice idea though because of horses' bad combat potential.

Post:
for the game it would look silly (no offense). If the topic was about the horn, then I think that the top one would add the “Battle Horn” that could impose the effect of 2 lvl srenght and add a second life band for 8 minutes. The horn would fall from pillager horner, which appeared on the 6th wave of the raid
I think that the Horn could also be used to make a Horn like what the Illagers use.
Amazing idea, will allow for much better traveling in early-mid game. It will Give horses a much needed buff.
Or you could put it on your head too.
To piggy-back off this post: this would make farming fields of crops much more efficient for players that aren’t red stone savvy
i dont have these but i want em

This obviously makes sense. As soon as I saw this block I immediately thought I should jump on it to see if I get hurt. Would be great for mob grinders. Many pro you tubers also suggested this in their snapshot reviews.
Should've been done long ago. Also, what the hell is the stonecutter powered by?
I do agree with you. Also, I think stone masons  shouldn't be given damage since they know how to use it (apprentice and higher).
The villagers might get hurt and that won't be good for trading halls where they need there stations to refresh trades.

This change is needed because:

- Stonecutters, with their animation are intuitively a dangerous spinning blade. It would make perfect sense for them to naturally damage players!

What it does:

- If the player or any monster stands on top of the stone-cutter, it should deal damage to them.

How it adds to Minecraft:

- Stone cutters would be perfect for dungeons, creating a unique sense of danger to pitfall traps.

- It would create a large amount of possibilities for players to design their own security systems.

- It is different than Magma Blocks because it would damage the player regardless of crouching, and it is different from thorn bushes because it would cause damage even without player movement.

I am glad that they brought it back after so many years of it being gone. Also I saw it as it would it do damage but was a little disappointed when I placed it down and walked across it but never got hurt. I was confused. There is a exposed blade and I thought it would damage.
Perhaps the blade will only do damage when it is powered by Redstone?
I like the idea

I also thought this would be damaging. So many ideas as soon as I saw the blade. Pun somewhat intended. But in all seriousness it simply makes more sense that it would cause damage, considering that a: spinning blades in real life are dangerous and b: if it can cut through stone it should be able to cut through players and mobs as well.
The Stonecutter should only rotate the sawblade, if it is powered by Redstone or if a player uses it
Yay please make it fast
This may be an old idea at this point, but I still hope it gets implemented eventually.

I concur. The grindstone should not animate unless used or powered by redstone. Should only cause damage when powered by redstone.

Further more, the grindstone should be placeable on walls and ceilings. If I understand correctly, the grindstone only has 2 states right now, indicating orientation. If it were attachable in any position it would only require 12 states to cover both orientations on any block face.
Stonecutters aren't actually very sharp in real life so good on mojang for not making them deal damage
lol even a berry bush and fresh snow can do damage, while a spinning steel blade is harmless. This needs to be changed asap.
what about slime balls and wool too ?
this seems cool but it could end up being annoying for some poeple.    however, this is still possible in game by giving yourself weakness and hitting with a gold sword.  this is a cool concept tho.

Hi dear developer of minecraft, i would suggest you a new course, the course of vampirism... When a weapon armor or item is going to break it start to consume your life to without breaking it (sorry for my english)

A feather would probably not be big enough to stop much damage (in real life) but maybe a wool block could work. Another commenter suggested slime balls, and maybe those could work as well, but deal more knockback

please, moving villagers is a huge pain 

at least make it a creative mod option
My thoughts exactly
Or just a stick and soul soil to be more like a redstone or regular torch
No, but you can make charcoal in the Nether, with the new update
I stick with that they should add sideway Slabs
true
This should be changed to equate to the soul campfire.

Crafting should be changed to one stick and one soul sand/soil, same as in the recipe for a Soul Campfire, where the soul sand/soil block took the place of coal.

This block burns forever, so the charcoal in the torch recipe is not needed, and the torch itself burns less, so it should not be more expensive than the usual one.
More biome diversity of everything would be great and give a reason to visit every biome.

Not to reject your idea, which I support, but the Jungle Biomes currently have slightly altered fishing loot tables. Nevertheless, I agree that it would be a pleasure if this treatment were given to most other biomes (even if only to discourage afk fishing)
Makes sense

I'd prefer biome locking, I just don't need all these pufferfish I catch at the river.

It's good for exploration too, honestly make me travel to these exciting places instead of spending more time trying to figure out how comparators work.
I agree, and imagine if fishing in the Deep Dark has a chance to pull up a Warden xD but first maybe they should make him unable to drown

I'd like to suggest adding slime balls to the river fishing loot table (or even swamp and mangrove biomes' fishing loot). The bottoms of rivers IRL can be very...slimey... so it feels natural to find that when fishing in a river, and it would provide some further access to a very limited resource for peaceful players or players who haven't found a slime chunk yet. It will also enable peaceful players to feed and breed frogs where that new 1.19 feature is essentially locked out for that group of players

Fish exclusive to certain biomes is a great idea and they should add at least 2 new fish for each biome. Like Northern pike and walleye to taiga. Bass and sunfish to forest. Catfish into swamps. Mahi Mahi in tropical ocean
This one would be okay, since you could use it to lure rabbits.
Since when have trains been able to drive upside down?  Mine carts are modeled after trains and real minecarts, not roller coasters.
And to add on to roller coaster idea, I would like to be able to attach the minecarts together with lead rope.
I voted for attaching minecarts with a lead in a different post.
Think think if this does get added, you would need high velocities to stay on the bottom and sides of blocks
Very good idea. Currently, is it explicit in the data of a cube on which side a railway lies, or is it implicit (assumed be on top, without any cube-specific bits to it)?
Cool idea was thinking the same but think you need rollercoaster carts
This is the one thing Minecraft is missing in my eyes.
I think we only need the sides, not the bottom. because the bottom would be kinda useless.
If this happens I will finally be able to make a loop the loop :)
We need this!!!
Airbus

Nice idea! Would be even cooler if this came with some fresh minecart physics so the cart would have to have a certain velocity to complete the loop. Alternatively, they could add a 'sticky' rail that prevents minecarts from falling down on the cost of not being powered (A magnetic rail would be more realistic, but I feel sticky rails are a more minecrafty solution)
Add a rail like a real life switch; activate by redstone or something and the rail rotates to a secong path of rails. I'm sorry i dont know whats its really called sorry

Corn Kernels could either come in a pile like current seeds or be singular. If they are singular, they should be put in a furnace to pop into a singular popcorn, which would give very little food points. Corn Kernels also have a chance to not pop, meaning you may get less popcorn than the kernals you put in
Corn stalks should grow to 2-3 blocks tall. There could also be different types of corn. You could eat the corn on a cob which may leave you with a husk, which could be fed to pigs or used as slop

i defently think corn should be added corn has so many uses in modern life. it could be used to make gas for future builds. you can make tortilla's out of them add a little beef and you have a taco. i think everyone wants to eat tacos in minecraft. the fields will look amazing and you can just eat corn raw or cooked
I really want corn

Could come in several colors - yellow, blue, red, white - and be bred together into a rainbow corn which would be more nutritious. Could make corn soup out of it, and farmers could trade different amounts for different colors of corn and corn soup. Could be rarer than wheat but grow to three blocks making it yield more. Could attract a new mob, crows, and could attract hostile mobs unless guarded by a scarecrow (Wheat, corn, pumpkin, leather tunic, and an armor stand?)

Minecraft needs corn immediatly, we cant let forntite have corn and frogs before minefcraft does, this is just not okay. Corn is amazing and should be respected enough to be in Minecraft and if it doesn't I will cry.

Corn would be a great add because it can be used in many different ways!
-The stalks could grow 2-3 blocks tall and when broken would give 1-2 corn cobs and 1-2 corn kernels.
-You could also build the stalks into a corn maze for Halloween lovers!
-You would use the kernels to plant new stalks, make popcorn in a furnace, or use it in a recipe for a new soup.
-The corn cobs would also have to be cooked to be eaten.
-You could also use corn to feed pigs, llamas, and horses.

From another comment, I love the idea of corn attracting a new mob of crows and the need for making a scarecrow!
Having Corn and Rice would be a great way to add variety to the feel of farms.

I think adding growth stages to corn (similar to melons and pumpkins) for the different heights and colors of it would really add a nice dimension to aesthetic field builds and would be great for corn maze construction for Halloween decoration or mini games.

OK! My Ideas for Corn

Corn Plant

... Grows 3 -5 blocks high (corn grows taller than people)

... works like Glow Berries, where the "vine/plant" can be picked without destroying the plant.

... harvested for a Corn on the Cob

Corn Cob

... crafted in the grid to make corn kernels

... fed to pigs

... eaten by player

 

Corn Kernels can be ...

... planted for new corn plants

... smelted for Popcorn

--- ground for corn meal

 

Cornmeal and Wheat make Corn Bread

I could probably go on and on and on, but hey this isn't a entire update just a new crop, and the Sniffer finds this seed.
Please add a water bar like health bar and a filter so you can’t drink from the ocean. If you run out, can you loose health? Lastly, please let us place bowls and have rice. Thank you!
As the new woods aren't flammable, their boats wouldn't be flammable either.
the boat variations all look fairly similar but this would allow for some cool looking colours to be added.
@Haruneko125 the player would still burn tho

I know the developers don't want to add the warped and crimson boats because they want the strider, but Crimson and Warped items are amazing looking and it would still be worthwhile to have them as normal boats for water. If you have to just make it not place able in lava and if it's steered into lava just have it sink and be destroyed. I know it doesn't burn but just have it be destroyed because it's not like you will get it back if it sinks to the bottom, especially to reduce lag. They would still be amazing boats even just for water. the stems were supposed to be wood like blocks and items, so there should at least be boats to use like normal boats. Please Mojang, this would be nice.

I voted because netherwood boats would be good if you came through a portal into an endless ocean in nether survival. Also, in nether survival, if we had netherwood boats, you can get boats early and trap piglin brutes in them when you get to a bastion! :)
Yeah this would be cool, making fire resistant boats would be OP, but when you finf a new type of wood, you expect to be able to make a boat out of it.
One of those features that should have already been in the game.

I agree that we should have them. It's pretty annoying when I go to make a boat with whatever wood I have, and I can't make it because it's warped or crimson. I don't think the boat should do anything different than the others, just a reskin.

I play bedrock edition my brother does, too. My brother was building a boat dock and wanted a warped/blue boat, but when he looked there was not a warped boat. He got very sad. So please add crimson and warped boats, there are boats of every wood type one is a raft (oak, dark oak,  birch, spruce, cherry, mangrove, acacia, jungle, and bamboo) it just doesn't make sense!!!
perfection
Oh i forgot! The reason i shared this was because i think that nether mobs should have weapons that come from the nether. I think it would make the most sense as they can't go to the overworld.

I like this idea, because the crossbow is the pillager's. But I think that the arrow should remain the same. Maybe it would do something special, like do extra damage in the nether but a small amount in the overworld
The feather item could be Strider hair. You shear it and you get the achievement " smooth like a babies..."
They should not only a nether crossbow, but an obsidian sword as well.
They should add steel into the game
A nether crossbow would be good, but since its made from nether stuff it should have stronger durability and be heavy so you are slower.

Actually, you can get everything you need for a crossbow in the nether. The trees of course would be your source of sticks, and when you kill a strider you get string. You can also get flint from the gravel found in the nether as well. Since piglins can open chests (not a feature actually in game but they get hostile if you open their chests so it is implied that they can) they could steal the iron from the fortresses. if you think about all the materials in the nether, you could most certainly make a crossbow in the nether.

Dork1Muffin, when you find a nether fortress you can find loot in the chests which means that Piglins never looted them. While i was playing the snapshots i never seen piglins have their own chest. Also, im talking about the getting the materials naturally from the nether. 

Edit: just realized you were talking about the newest one, but i still think that it would make sense for a nether only made crossbow.

Potentially a way to include this would be to add a form of 'flint' to the nether, to explain how the piglins get arrows, and make the tripwire hook craftable using gold. This would likely fix this issue!

I’ve been thinking of an idea for a weapon called the “Crimson Hammer”. How ever I cannot post my idea because it is too similar to the war hammer idea, but my crimson hammer would be a weapon wielded by either the Piglins to replace the crossbow, or The Piglin Chief, if there ever is one, as its primary weapon. The enchants for this weapon are “chilling force” which does more damage to nether mobs, and “light Handel” which decreases the charge up time for the crimson hammer since it is a fairly slow weapon. It has the same durability as the trident, and cannot be crafted. It does 10 attack damage, with a slow recharge time, slower then the trident. It cannot be enchanted with any other weapon enchants, but can be enchanted with unbreaking and mending. As for design, I’m not sure. I was thinking of the hammer itself to look like it’s made of Netherite, and the Handel can look like the crimson stem texture. And there can be a gold line around the middle of the hammer as like a support, or a tie tying it to Handel. But this is just my idea as either a weapon replacement for the cross bow, or a primary weapon for the Piglin Chief, if there ever is one to come. (I am writing this comment as if the 20w16a snapshot).

There is also no “natural” way of getting iron from the nether. I do not count looting nether fortresses as “natural” because, where did the fortresses get the iron. If there was a mob that dropped iron nuggets, or a nether iron ore (which I don’t like the idea of), or a way to craft iron nuggets from something.

I mean iron isn't natural in the nether but you can still make a crossbow. Also the complete update isn't done yet so who knows. They may add a mob that drops iron or iron nuggets. Also catcagames there is natural spawning gravel in the nether and if you mine gravel it has a chance of dropping flint.

It seems like a nether-friendly crafting recipe for crossbows might do the trick.  I have trouble agreeing with new weapon suggestions while the combat system is as in need of rebalancing as it currently is.

Fortunately, combat is currently receiving the attention it needs so I may change my mind about this in the future.
Just being stronger and doing more attack damage is good
Or it could be crafted from gold ingots nether wart and golden tripwire hook.
Along these lines, what if the piglins use special gold ore which makes better gear?

I like having a new method of transportation for the sea, but this is too much. Why not implement a small ship that can be occupied by three to four players? Better yet, have the ship be harder to control since it has significantly more space and some more weight on it.
I think that will make a good decision
You should have to build the ship your self and then place down a block to turn it into a ship like how some mods do it.
You should have to build the ship your self and then place down a block to turn it into a ship like how some mods do it.
Coll
Amazing idea. It would be great for when you play with friends.
And/or dog whistle!
I think a whistle would be a better addition for dogs or maby even all pets.

I am totally on board for something like this. I created a command book that kinda does this with what's already in the game. The command bellow makes them stand, while replacing the 0 at the end with 1 would make them sit. (You will need to enter your own UUID, with the dashes in the right place, if you try to use this for yourself)

/execute at @e[type=minecraft:wolf,nbt={OwnerUUID:"xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"},distance=0..64] run data merge entity @e[type=wolf,distance=0..0,limit=1] {Sitting:0}

Basically I can use the /data command to make my wolves sit/stand, but only for one wolf at a time. So I use /execute and target every wolf that has my UUID in it's NBT data within 64 blocks, and make each wolf that fits the criteria run the command on itself. 

If it's already possible to do in game with commands it can't be that hard to implement as an item.

I think that a whistle item could be used to command tamed mobs. It could be made with 5 gold ingots/nuggets, right clicking a mob or player would make tames hostile towards them, right clicking air would make them sit and stop being aggro, and right clicking a block would call tames to that spot and stop their aggro. This could be very useful for organizing tames and commanding them in combat, alongside finally making a way for us to stop our dogs from attacking friends.

It would be nice if it teleported distant tames to you when using it on a block, an idea suggested in this post:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360049708311-Pet-Summoning-Whistle?page=1#community_comment_360009657992
I had this idea too!!! Good to see this :)
this would be a really good idea beacause if u lost your home and your dogs were sitting down there you would lose them but with pet whistle you wouldent please add this in to the game #2020

I think a pet whistle to call any/all pets to you would be great. Also to be able to send them all back to your home base. Maybe 1 whistle with options to call a specific species (dogs, cats, parrots, etc.) to you or a specifically named one. Also have an option to sit them all down at once as a group or to stand them all up at once instead of one at a time.

A whistle to summon pets even ones that are not in loaded chunks would be amazing. Too often pets warp themselves into weird locations, or if you try going directly up they can no longer follow you. Its frustrating to say the least. 4 copper bars to craft the whistle would be neat.

My take on a pet whistle is for all pets. Use the whistle to force all pets to sit, then whistle again for all pets to follow.

Alternatively, could have the crosshairs aimed at a certain pet and use it to sit or follow command.
FRAND
CONCRETE STAIRS

Voted. Vital for texture coherence when building concrete architectures

I'm currently remaking a museum from a short film on youtube (mainly consists of gray concrete), and I had to use stone stairs at the entry. They aren't good and affect the color integrity, within the first glance from the front you can spot the difference.
Concrete stairs are a must have and I hope they add them soon. This would give builders a much need color pallet when building. Please add theses soon!!!
I think any solid colored block should have a stair and slab option. with the exception of gravel, sand and concrete powder.
my build needs lime stairs we need this for builds and paths for city's and parks Mojang ADD NOW
Concrete stairs would be so amazing. I love using concrete in my builds but get frustrated at times because I can't use stairs to keep the colour going up or down the stairs.

I think this could even work by making your player one block tall instead of two. Its not all that different, but it could make for some interesting gameplay to have the player the size of a zombie baby. You could make interesting escape routes from your bases that wouldn’t be previously possible, and mine more efficiently. You’d just have to be aware of your time limit or you would grow back to normal and suffocate yourself.
YYYYYYEEEEEEEESSSSSS
Do you hear me Minecraft we need this!
Hey, can you make two shrinking potions for me and my sister? We want to be tiny people, building a tiny house.

When drunk, you become smaller, right? So when you become smaller, and then destroy or place a block, I want the space or block to be 1 pixel of a Minecraft block (not the size of a block). Also I want it to be temporary, like lasting a minute or two.
They should be only possible to get with endgame loot, maybe from stuff in the End
ADD THIS TO MINECRAFT NOWWWWWWWWWWWW

I would love this idea. One change suggestion. Use the new warped fungus to shrink down to .5x and .25x size depending on potion strength (Shrink I and Shrink II), and the crimson fungus to grow 2x or 4x in size, allowing slightly higher jumps and some added damage as well as some damage reduction to the player. Basically using the New Nether Fungi so that while it's not late game, it'll still require some effort to get to

I loved the Gulliver Mod when it was still being supported, but I think 8x and .125x is a bit extreme. Would also love to see SOME of the other Gulliver mod features make it in as well. Like the paper gliding, the fishing rod grapple hook, as well as the fact that most hostile mobs ignore you when shrunk. Basically using the shrink potion for slight stealth/expanded mobility, and the Growth Potion being used for Tanking and Damage

Plus with a shrink potion, there'll be no need for crawling to become a bedrock parity update. They can call this update "The Small World Update"
We need shrink potion an small tools in minecraft plz add it

I love this idea but there should be commands not potions but we can get the potion by commands so we can shrink our friends instantly till their a pixel! There should also be like a pixel tool breaker so it digs PIXELS! I know this may break the game but man i think everyone would like this like if you all think its a good idea!
This is cool because... A:You can do awesome PVP battle's. B:better traveling. C:The open field idea will inspire players to build those outside plan ramp things.
I agree. A boeing 747 would be nice instead of mods.
Not a new plane though more like what the wright brothers made
This is cool but I think it should be biplanes instead of new day planes that you can find crashed and repair them that would be cool.
No planes they don’t fit with the Minecraft feel at all! We already have the means of flight
i think plane sould be like minecart and boat, two type, chested plane and normal plane.an mini plane, not the large one, try to jump off it, you will die.

I think the official can actually add the engine and steering wheel, rather than directly adding certain vehicles. Divide the engine into three types: large, medium, and smal.and provide different speeds based on their size. Put them into the player's building, place a steering wheel to control them, and let the player decide which blocks to move and which ones not to move before controlling them. This approach is not only convenient for players, but also does not suppress Minecraft's creativity. I think it is a good idea.
I have to agree with you on rarer blocks offering better abilities. But you seem to have forgotten fuel in your post, as you talked about wanting that a bit.

I originally wanted fuel quality to be tied to the length of time the beacon would run, but since the current system lets you run your beacon indefinitely after fueling it just once, I was afraid that it would not be a popular idea :( Do you have any alternative options?

The type of fuel (or maybe catalyst since it doesn’t run out) used could similarly contribute to the effects available, perhaps.  Like maybe if you sacrifice a diamond to the beacon rather than an iron ingot it would give you access to stronger effects using a smaller pyramid, and stronger effects than would normally be available on a full pyramid.

@ClayGoddessSari That's an option but I'm afraid it would disincentivize making a pyramid out of expensive blocks. Maybe fuel should be dispensed with altogether? Or maybe we make a completely different item work as a catalyst, like redstone dust or something?

Except they would work hand in hand.  Like you could get haste II from a level 3 pyramid made of expensive blocks and using an expensive catalyst, but only a combination of the two.

 

Although my main worry with reworking beacons is making the whole system too complex.  I can just imagine needing a comprehensive wiki page to be able to figure out how many diamond blocks I need to include in my beacon to unlock a specific special effect.

@ClayGoddessSari Now I see. You're saying that the better quality the beacon, the more premium the fuel required. I like that.

And as for complexity - the wiki page for beacons is already pretty complex :P

I’m actually not sure what I’m proposing.  Just that the better fuel and the better blocks would both add to the benefits you could get.

The most nebulous is they would both contribute to the level of the effects available, but it would take using both a good block and a good fuel to get the best effects.

A more concrete version is that better blocks increase the level of effects available and better fuel lets you choose more effects per beacon, or visa versa.
I like how specific this is more than the idea, most people on this site have bad grammar and aren't specific at all! so thank You, thank You

@ProfFox101 Thanks for the comment, it means a lot for someone to appreciate the effort. You're more than welcome to see my other posts for similarly presented ideas :) And if you have time, check out ClayGoddessSari's ideas too, they are really well thought-out.

I will take a look at all of your ideas too sometime soon!
This idea hasn't gotten any attention in about six months, and I'd like to get some fresh feedback on it ^^

I personally think the important thing is the fuel. The blocks are a one-time thing, and you could always break the pyramid down to get those blocks back at no net cost. It's really no different than keeping them in storage till you need them. This isn't to say there isn't work involved (and I absolutely agree hard work needs to be rewarded), I just think the important thing is what are you giving up to run it and keep it running. Destroying one diamond for an effect that will last forever isn't a huge sacrifice. Having to dump in a stack of blaze rods every few days is.

What if the best beacon had to be made from bottom to top in gold, emerald, diamond, netherite? I feel like this would encourage exploration or automation. In addition to all this i think that getting 9 blocks of netherite with a beacon should be a fully powered standered beacon and 34 blocks of diamond as well. All the other materials would have to be a full pyramid.

385268462151 Sorry for the late reply. I am sympathetic to your desire for increasing the work required to keep a beacon up and running. However, I think most people will dislike this, because most people see a beacon as a large amount of grindy work up-front in exchange for a convenient, easy-to-use long-term buff afterwards.

In other words, you're proposing a massive increase in required effort for essentially zero increase in reward. That won't go over well.

390060909991 Maybe! I hadn't even thought about the impact netherite would have on this idea to be honest

Each layer of neteorite could allow you to increase the level of any already available effect. Otherwise, netherite could have just 3QP (the extra effect level makes up for this, and you COULD get a level 5 effect from solid Netherite.

Also, should EMERALD be that good? I think not. QP should be assigned to our materials as so:

  • Iron:2
  • Emerald:1
  • Gold:3
  • Diamond:5
  • Netherite:3

And the following average QPs should give you (1 of) the following effects:

1.5QP: same as post

2QP: same as post

2.5QP: same as post

3QP: Glowing (like spectral arrows), Invisibility, Night Vision

3.5QP: Absorption 2, Slow Falling

4QP: Absorption 4, Regeneration 2

That QP system would not work. Iron is the easiest to obtain and farm, it should be 1 QP. Gold is slightly harder to farm than emerald, but much easier to obtain. (I've built a gold farm but not an emerald farm, but I can see how an emerald farm wouldn't be hard to make using villager breeding) Gold and emerald should be 2 QP. Diamond is exponentially harder than any of the others, so it should be 5 QP. Netherite is exponentially harder than any of the others, so it should be 20 QP, so even a small amount of Netherite (Still hard to obtain) could reach max QP. I know that sounds OP, but to make a 20% netherite max beacon would take more than 1100 ancient debris. With the rest Iron it would take ~850 Ancient Debris, and with the rest gold/emerald it would take ~570 Ancient Debris.

This must change yes or yes and the ideas of MacchuPicchu96 and the others are absolutely good but there is a small flaw here, what would happen if a player combines blocks for the pyramid? That is, it would not be an entirely iron or diamond pyramid (to give an example) but all the blocks will be from all valid blocks, whether in order or in disorder, there should be a scale of power in the faithful style of the altar of the mod "Blood Magic"? Now, the fuel or the catalyst could be a new item depending on the material or materials used in the pyramid or that if the minerals preset as "catalyst" (iron, gold, diamond, emerald and netherite) are kept that have a new mechanics of use for times, something like potions but focused on the beacon (iron: 3m, gold: 8m, diamond: 20m, emerald: 1h and netherite: no time), this would also encourage players to get better materials for the catalyst of the beacon to have a longer effect time, it could even be that when the beacon is running out of fuel, the light beam starts to blink or simply its "thickness" decreases (the visual appearance of the beacon would change to deactivated when the light is thin and vice versa); Now, if the time would not be adequate, what do you think if the "catalyst" acts in the range of effect? Clearer would be like a plus to the rank, iron: unchanged, gold: +4 blocks, diamond: +10 blocks, emerald: +18 blocks and netherite: +28 blocks and of course, it would act at the radius of the effect circumference.

I think that the simplest change to beacons would just be to give a bonus to their range based on the types of blocks below them. This way it would be less technical to get the basic beacon upgrades, but the more expensive blocks get a farther distance. The only downside is that you wouldn't know the exact distance of the beacons effects if you cared before you make the beacon, but it would be easy to play around with  the blocks until you have the right distance if you are that far in the late game.

What if instead of materials determining power, different materials determined different uses for the beacon? (With more expensive materials still offering more powerful effects.) In this manner, you could make a beacon entirely out of one material for the most powerful benefits of said material, or out of different materials to get the benefits of each. 

* Beacon fuel has a new property: Players who put fuel into the beacon receive its effects, while others do not.

Iron ~ Effects related to efficiency and productivity, could have effects related to mining and building. (Or preventing mining and building.)

Gold ~ Effects related to speed, combat, and offensive power. Higher level beacons could even have a guardian style laser attack to defend the beacon itself.

Emerald ~ Regeneration and Defense, could boost crop growth. Higher levels could create a defensive shield of some sort?

Diamond ~ Highest level, (Primarily because diamonds are non-renewable), extremely powerful boons. (...Not quite sure what, but you get the idea.)

Yes I like your thinking, but I think each level should add 20 blocks to its radius, and that there is no limit to how many layers you can do, so if someone wants to make like a 10 level beacon the range would be about 200 blocks and it doesn't matter what blocks are used. Also the fuel used should make better strengths so if you use gold or iron it might be level 1 and if you use diamonds or netherite ingots you get level 2 of whatever you choose

I still think beacons should be limited to three tiers, even if different materials were given different specialties- this way it forces players to carefully consider which benefits they want. (Or go through the work of building multiple beacons to get the best of each different material.) More than three layers just seems a bit excessive, even with farms.
If you use a heavy core on a Beacon, the beacon should increase its radius by 10 and give you a Trial Key.

I had a similar idea.

With the addition of netherite, it would make sense to add a new tier of equipment associated with the End as well.

Since the Nether has a theme of fire and brimstone, even with the update, netherite was made to be better suited for spending time in the Nether (knockback resistance, doesn't burn, etc). So this Pearlstone would have to make spending time in the End easier, but how? Teleportation. The major theme with the End is teleportation. Endermen are everywhere, Shulkers can teleport, you teleport a short distance when you eat Chorus Fruit, you get the idea.

What if Pearlstone armor made island hopping easier? Most people use Ender Pearls to hop from island to island, but they are consumed, and they hurt you. What if with each piece of Pearlstone armor equipped, it would either protect you from Ender Pearl damage somewhat, or give you a chance to get your used Ender Pearl back, but not both.

Enderite weapons, on the other hand, will mess with the target's ability to teleport. They could apply a debuff that prevents the target from teleporting by any means, even with portals.

I would suggest adding a new metal - "bronze" to the game (not ore). The bronze would be created by smelting copper + iron together (I know bronze is traditionally made with copper and tin). The furnace functionality could be modified to accommodate 2 metals or a new "smelter" could be developed to perform this function. The bronze could be used to craft all of the same items that currently use iron, gold, diamonds, etc. The durability would be in between gold and iron, but with added damage for cutting items and arrows. In addition to making a new metal available for crafting items, it would provide a much needed additional use for copper ore.
